meanings.definition: To cut or form a groove in (a piece of wood or metal)
meanings.sent1: He chined the wood to make a shelf.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter chined the metal to create a decorative pattern.
meanings.sent3: She chined the wood so precisely that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor chined the marble with expert skill.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the chined wood echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The boat had a sleek, chined design.
meanings.sent2: The chined hull of the ship cut smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent3: The chined edges of the car gave it a futuristic look.
meanings.sent4: Her chined features were elegant and refined.
meanings.sent5: The chined surface gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To fit or strengthen with chines
meanings.sent1: He chined the boat to improve its stability.
meanings.sent2: The builder chined the structure to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: Chining the frame added an extra layer of support.
meanings.sent4: She chined the armor to enhance its protective qualities.
meanings.sent5: The chined reinforcement made the bridge stronger.
